Description: Red-brown pottery ostracon, from the body of a ribbed vessel, interior covered with a black resinous substance, with remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, partially faded.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.30, pl.23)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82581) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82581)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 23:2 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
